intro: Crepis denticulata, commonly known as the toothed hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. Its leaves are typically toothed or serrated, giving it its common name. Crepis denticulata is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
